intro: Centaurea pauciloba, commonly known as the sparseleaf knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Centaurea pauciloba is generally low-growing and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
